leads.lead_text: Phyllodes not pungent-pointed, or rarely absent
Phyllodes pungent-pointed
Branchlets triangular in cross-section, to winged; flowers in regular umbel; East Gippsland only
Branchlets somewhat angular to more or less terete; flowers in raceme, but rachis sometimes short
Bracts conspicuous, 2–4 mm long, spreading widely
Bracts inconspicuous, 0.75–2 mm long, more or less appressed to pedicel
Phyllode margins entire, tertiary venation obscure; inflorescence rachis usually 20–30 mm long; Grampians and Mt Cole area only
Phyllode margins minutely crenate, tertiary venation reticulate and prominent; inflorescence rachis 25–80 mm long
Racemes 40–120 mm long; montane areas
Racemes less than 25 mm long
Phyllodes linear, upper surface somewhat convex; venation conspicuous with a longitudinal vein near each margin
Phyllodes ovate to obovate, rarely linear, margins flat or undulate; venation sometimes obscure, pinnate
Phyllodes ovate to circular, minutely crenate, glossy, green; base cordate to rounded; montane areas
Phyllodes narrow-elliptic to narrow-obovate, usually entire, dull green or slightly glaucous; base tapered, rarely cuneate
Phyllodes terete or slightly compressed vertically; midrib not apparent
Phyllodes horizontally flattened or subulate; midrib apparent above or below
Phyllodes compressed vertically, strongly decurrent by a 3–10 mm broad base, usually perpendicular to the branchlets, blue-grey; Little Desert and adjacent areas only
Phyllodes terete, rarely slightly compressed, if decurrent then scarcely so, perpendicular or oblique to the branchlets, green
Phyllodes oblique to stem, less than 6 mm long, stout, slightly recurved; pod inflated
Phyllodes more or less perpendicular to stem, 5–30 mm long, slender, straight; pod compressed
Phyllodes continuous with branchlets; pod less than 7 mm long
Phyllodes articulate on branchlets; pod more than 7 mm long
Plants root-suckering; stipules absent; north-central Victoria (and possibly Grampians)
Plants not root-suckering; minute (<1 mm long) stipules present; SA border to Bendigo area
Plants usually grey-hispid; phyllodes concave above, V-shaped in section, mid-vein prominent below
Plants glabrous or hispid; phyllodes flat or convex above, midvein prominent above
